comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[edited - Originally titled "Unidentified view - possibly Hawkesbury (NSW)"]

I'm flummoxed !  From the shadows, a south-facing shore and pier, with enough white picket fencing for anyone's dream home . . . 

I was thinking it was a very early view of Manly Cove (New Brighton) from Osborne Road, but I can't match the jetty to other photos.  Any other ideas?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Yes, it's tricky.  With those round benches at the left and the path/road down to the water, it feels like the photographer is standing in a park...or perhaps in the grounds of a lighthouse?

AB

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I dont think it is Sydney.    It is somewhere like Bungwahl or Soldier's Point or Tumbi Umbi.  Somewhere on a lake.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: You know if this picture was reversed left and right ( printed backwards ),  it could conceivably be at Kurnell.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Have you got a link to a Kurnell pic that we could compare it with?

AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: E U R E K A ! Toronto on Lake Macquarie, NSW. Looking SE from Hotel Toronto. Date - ca. 1891 Photographer - Ralph Snowball (?) Compare with slightly later photo (railway line and windmill) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/4811507722/] A huge collection of Toronto photos and memorabilia - www.flickr.com/search/?q=toronto&w=8571926%40N06 Brief history of Toronto - www.lakemac.infohunt.nsw.gov.au/library/lhist/suburb/lmp&... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto,_New_South_Wales It is so obvious when you know!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The railway / tramway opened on 7 March 1891 ( trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13816744 ) , which implies this photo is 1890, when the line was being built.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00]  It's amazing how we look for 'the familiar' even in old photographs, in the original shot the bleached out background sends us no cues (er clues) but once we see the context and backdrop all becomes clear. (Mind you the railway line helps as well)

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Truly an amazing find! Was this another stumble-upon or did you set your heart on discovering the answer to this one?

I'll update the caption :)

AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw]  This was yet another stumble-upon, as usual when looking for something different.  I thought the land form, composition, and LIGHT looked familiar in this photo as a thumbnail in CCUON's photostream, and did some research on Toronto.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/uon/3208921360/]
